topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Deleting a System

body.p: You can lock and unlock a system, for example when you need to make a change to the system.
body.note: This feature applies only to KVM Region servers.
body.p: You can remove a compute node from the pool of available resources. You may need to remove a compute node in order to replace a failed host, or to change the configuration of a host. If the host is active, you can migrate instances on it by locking the host.
Caution: Before locking a host, ensure that sufficient resources are available on other hosts to migrate any running instances.

section.title: Delete a host
section.p: To delete a host system from the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system:

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Horizon Dashboard.
Click Inventory on the System Panel section of the Admin menu, and then selecting the Hosts tab.

ol.li:
Lock the standby controller by clicking More then Lock Host for the controller.
Wait for the host to be reported as Locked
Click More > Delete Host for the host you want to delete.
Power down the host and remove the hardware from the cluster.
